Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.Server
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the game server. It continuously waits for connection requests from clients and handles them in separate threads. Depending on their initial choice on the number of players, clients are enqueued in lobbies, waiting for other clients to connect and start a game. When a game is over the server automatically removes it from the list of active games

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Server​(int port)
    Creates a new server running on this machine and listening to the specified port

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server​(int port) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a new server running on this machine and listening to the specified port
      Parameters:
      port - The port number the server listens to
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an issue occurs during the construction of the ServerSocket object

  • Method Details

    • registerConnection

      public void registerConnection​(RemoteConnection c)
      This method adds an active RemoteConnection to the list of active connections maintained by the server
      Parameters:
      c - The remoteConnection to add to the active connections list

    • removeConnection

      public void removeConnection​(RemoteConnection c)
      This method removes a RemoteConnection from the list of active connections kept by the server. This happens after a voluntary disconnection by the client, a network problem or after a game is over
      Parameters:
      c - The remoteConnection to deregister from the active connections list

    • removeGame

      public void removeGame​(Controller finishedGame)

    • run

      public void run()
      With this method, the server continuously waits for connection requests from clients and dispatches them to a new dedicated thread, that handles their initialization. Besides, the server iterates on a list of active games, checking that they are still active and removing them if they are no longer active (that is, if they are over)

    • isNicknameAlreadyConnected

      public boolean isNicknameAlreadyConnected​(java.lang.String nickname)
      This method checks if the specified nickname is already connected to the server. Nicknames MUST be unique
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname to check
      Returns:
      true if the specified nickname is already connected, false otherwise

    • lobby2Players

      public void lobby2Players​(RemoteConnection remoteConnection)
      This method is executed after a RemoteConnection is initialized, that is after the client user has specified a valid nickname and a valid number of players. Clients that have selected a 2-players game as their choice are put in a dedicated queue, where they wait for other clients with the same preference to start a new game. When the needed number of players (2) is reached, a new game is created and the clients involved are removed from the queue
      Parameters:
      remoteConnection - The remoteConnection to enqueue

    • lobby3Players

      public void lobby3Players​(RemoteConnection remoteConnection)
      This method is executed after a RemoteConnection is initialized, that is after the client user has specified a valid nickname and a valid number of players. Clients that have selected a 3-players game as their choice are put in a dedicated queue, where they wait for other clients with the same preference to start a new game. When the needed number of players (3) is reached, a new game is created and the clients involved are removed from the queue
      Parameters:
      remoteConnection - The remoteConnection to enqueue
